Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BolsEngland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Albro House Hotel from the 21st - 24th January and found it was very good value for money. It is situated very near to Lancaster Gate and Paddington underground stations so it is in a very good location. Our room was very clean and quiet and the English breakfast was well cooked. Joseph and his wife were very friendly and helpful. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, very friendly staff, I would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Oregon78
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband and son (3 years old) for 8 nights in a three bedded room on the first floor. The room was very quiet, clean and had all the comforts I could ask. English breakfast was very good and ready cooked, with a wide choice; every morning and night I asked for I bottle of hot milk for my son and it was immediately prepared. The hotel is in a great position, Kensington Gardens is just one block away, as Paddington station, and the owner was very friendly. I would stay there if visiting London again.

Reviews.Title: “First suspicious, later happy”
Reviews.Author: neitsytmaria
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with my friend for 5 nights in June 2011. There are several B&B’s around Paddington Station. We walked around the area asking the rates: Albro Hotel had vacant rooms and we got a twin room with 80 pounds per night. The manager told us that we had to pay the whole amount of 400 pound up front, and they would accept only cash. This sounded very suspicious: why would they ask us something like this? Is there something wrong with the hotel and they want us to pay the whole amount before we notice the problem? Or do they think we’re some sort of criminals who will not pay the bill? (Not likely, because I gave my name, passport number and credit card number when we made the reservation.) We agreed to pay the first night right away and the rest the next day if everything would be ok. The room was in the 4th floor, no elevator. We were ok with that, but people with restricted mobility might want to get a room from the lower floors. The room was clean and nice. The temperature in the room was good and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom and the shower were clean. The bathroom floor was wooden, covered with thick plastic – a bit weird, but not uncomfortable. The street in front of the hotel is quite busy, but the traffic noise didn’t bother us at night. The breakfast was good. In the breakfast room you will be asked whether you’d like an English breakfast or a continental one. We tried both and they were both very nice. The breakfast ended at 9:00, which was a bit too early for us. After one night we paid the rest of the amount. When leaving the place we asked for a receipt and got it. We enjoyed our stay and would probably go back. The location was very nice, just one block from the Paddington Station. Considering the hotel prices in London the value was good. The only thing that left me wondering is why they want all the money paid up front. I see that other TripAdvisor users have paid attention to the same thing. Fix this, continue the breakfast until 9:30 and it’s a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly host and staff. Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: GunillaA
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I stayed here for four nights. The location is very good with nice restaurants within five minutes walk. Our room was clean. The beds are very good. The host and staff are friendly and the breakfast room is cosy. We enjoyed the English breakfast every morning. We can recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice location, nice building, not so nice room”
Reviews.Author: clarasarabella
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for a weekend trip to London. The price was ok (90Â£ or so) and the location good. Unfortunately paying almost 100Â£ does not guarantee you any level of cleanliness in London. You'd have to go for at least 150Â£. So while the building looks charming from the outside, the rooms themselves are not that great. The size is ok, but the standard is rather low. I thought the bathroom was particularly low standard. Breakfast is served in a room which is right next to the kitchen in the basement where smoke hits your face as soon as you walk down the stairs. Having said that, the owner was very polite and they did offer a range of cooked breakfasts (though I personally prefer simple continental without the smoke).

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay and very fine situated”
Reviews.Author: DanishTilst
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were met by the manager who told us that there was a problem about our room as the central heating sÃ½stem didnÂ´t work properly. But in a very polite and competent way he let us chooze between 2 alternatives. And we were very satisfied by the way the problem was handled. The full English breakfast was good and, the rooms (as we tried 2 of them) clean and comfortable and the manager very friendly and helpfull. We will certainly try to get a room here again next time we will go to London. Absolutely value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Pay up front”
Reviews.Author: toolieak
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room for 4 nights in October. Once we got through the front door, the manager told us that we were required to pay the total amount up front in cash, despite the reservation confirmation not saying anything to that. We agreed to pay half on check-in and the rest on departure. Also, when I made the reservation, the website's tarriff page was not clear, so I emailed to ask if the off-shoulder rates were in effect, or if they would be L88/night. The owner replied and said that a discount would be applied. When I mentioned that to the manager, he didn't know anything about it, so I ended up paying the full rate. The room was clean and comfortable and I was grateful for the en suite. The location was good, really close to Paddington Station, so navigation was easy. It was ok, but I was angry that we had to pay cash up front. If that had been explained during the reservation process, I wouldn't have chosen this hotel. Double check before you choose to stay here. Frankly, I wish we'd stayed at the Travelodge for L67/night like we had at the first half of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel with BAD management”
Reviews.Author: Savitar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Albro house in Sept 2010 for one night. I just need somewhere cheap to stay for one night as I work in London and had a concert to go to that night (but live outside of London). I found Albro house, checked the reviews on Tripadvisor and saw they had a single room for Â£54 a night, so I thought I would give it a try. I booked through their own website which was quick and easy however the strange thing was that it said I could only check in between 2 and 4pm. So on the day of check in I rang up at 2pm and asked if it would be OK to check in at 6pm. I was told they did not have a record of my booking and that there was a problem with their booking system. Also, they did not have any single rooms left so I would have to pay for an upgrade to a double room for Â£75. I disagreed, told them I had a booking with them for Â£54 and he would need to honer that. He told me that he would sort something out when I arrived. I arrived at 6pm to the manager who immediately said in a very up happy voice â€œAre you the angry one who abused me earlier?â€�. No hello, no sorry for OUR FAULT, just abuse that I was upset that he told me I did not have a room. Seriously!!! Great customer service that. I was very taken back by this and all I could do was to apologise and say that I did not mean it to come across like that (I have no idea what he was talking about, I was perfectly nice, but told him he had to honour the contract) but to be told that I would have to pay more for THEIR mistake was not going to happen. So we head to the â€œreceptionâ€� area. He tells me that I need to pay for an upgrade as its not his fault that HIS website is wrong. I disagreed of course and said â€œwhy should the customer have to suffer for your websites issuesâ€�, I even offer to skip breakfast if that will help (His response to that was â€œI donâ€™t care about breakfast so NO, it does not help your causeâ€�, again, not sure what sort of customer service that is). He tells me how this is SUCH a big issue for him, that he will get in trouble if he gives me a room, how could I expect him to give me a room etc etc. What I want to understand is, why is this my fault? I booked on their web site, go a confirmed booking and even rang to ensure that everything was ok. He eventually (after a LOT of complaining, go through books and mumbling under his breath about how much of an issue this was, says, â€œOK, I will give you a room for Â£54 BUT, its a room with a double and two single beds, you MUST ONLY sleep on the single bed, you MUST ONLY use one towel, you MUST ONLY use on bar of soap!â€�. Seriously??? In the end, another customer turned up and his response was â€œOh no, not another customer!â€� So getting onto the hotel itself, its in a great location, about 2 mins walk from Paddington station. The hotel is clean enough (please flush the toilet when cleaning the room cleaning staff, no one wants to see that). In the room I was in, one of the single beds was broken and the double bed was VERY used. The single I had was fine, if about 50 years old. The bathroom was OK, very musky smell though and the shower was just fine. All the furniture was at least 20 years old and showed it. There was a very small TV with only analogue TV channels, two of which could actually be watched. No clock or alarm in there though. I can not comment about the breakfast. All in all this would be OK if you need to stay for one night if you are desperate but EXCEPTIONALLY poor management of both their booking system and the onsite management lets this place down.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible stay, top floor with no lift, poor ventilation - felt very hostile.”
Reviews.Author: ratemerateyou
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival there were no staff on reception.. there wasn't even a reception area in fact! The stay just went downhill from there onwards. The manager refused to recognise a guest who was living next door to me despite them being in possession of a key. My room was located on the top floor and there was no lift and the stairs would've been difficult to manage for elderly visitors. The room had all the required facilities, however it would have been more acceptable in cooler temperatures. Beware, the hotel only accepts cash payment. The staff are the biggest let down at this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Good position, friendly people and free wifi”
Reviews.Author: StefanoW
Reviews.Content: I'm in London for work every one or two months and I am a regular customer at Albro since a couple of years; all I can say about it are good things: of course it's not the Grand Hotel, but for a good price you can have a clean room with ensuite services and free wifi internet access (which is a good plus if you need to work). Manager and personnel are very friendly and the position is great: you're in central London, with Paddington and Lancaster Gate tube stations within minutes; if you want to walk, in 15 minutes you can be in Oxford Street or Hyde Park. Definitely a good choice if you need to come to central London and you don't want to spend too much money.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, small, homely, clean,..home from home, friendly”
Reviews.Author: healthfirst2020
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Albro House many times, at least 4 times a year for years now and always have the same excellent friendly service..The hotel is well established and is very English in its decor and service. A little old fashioned..but isnt that a plus in this rushed wolrld? This is a quiet hotel and you are guaranteed a peaceful night in spotlessly clean rooms. The owner is there to help and there is a good breakfast to set you up for the day. If he is not there he has a lovely manageress, who will make you feel at home and her level of service is excellent...she has been there many years and you are in safe hands.

Reviews.Title: “Badly managed!”
Reviews.Author: holybuble
Reviews.Content: we've stayed at Albro last year and overall our experience was pretty good. This time we found this lady who didn't know how to manage a single thing that was happening there! Don't even wanna start with the chambers maid who was totally insane: she even opened our door several times without even knocking! not to mention she didn't speak a single word in english.. It was pretty awkard and embarassing i have to say!! And it kinda ruined our journey there. The Hotel per se is in a very good location,and the neighborhood(Paddington) is one of the most vital of London in terms of pubblic services,restaurants and such. In the same street of Albro you can find TONS of Small Hotels like Albro,so do yourself a favour: try somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Small,hot room BUT close to the sights!”
Reviews.Author: jillmet
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Albro House for two nights on a stop over to Eastern Europe. We were 4 friends staying in a quad room. It was VERY tight and got really hot at night. The sheets were clean and the beds were somewhat comfortable. The decor is very outdated! The bathroom was kind of on the gross side (the floor was falling apart) but it did the job. The best part about this place is that it is just a few minutes to Paddington (which has direct trains from Heathrow!!!), has many pubs and restaurants around and is close to walk to Hyde Park etc. And the cute little breakfast room in the basement served up a decent breakfast to start the day! I don't think I'd stay here again because I am sure there are other places around that can offer a bit more for 135 pounds a night! This was all that we could find in a good location only a few weeks in advance. It does the job if you're desperate for a place!

Reviews.Title: “Small room, but a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Dave86
Reviews.Content: This is not a fancy place, but it doesn't pretend to be. We arrived for 5 nights after 3 weeks traveling through Europe. Even so, our room still surprised me by how small it was. Mind you, we are a family of 4. My kids loved it, it was like camping, we'd hop in to bed and talk until we went to sleep. The fellow who owns the place is a classic, very nice and helpful. The included breakfast is great. The room was cleaned every day and spotless. Location is great, 2 minute walk to Hyde park, 10 minute walk to Oxford St. Unless I win the lottery, I'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Travel1121
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - 2 minutes walk from Paddington station in a nice quiet street. There are plenty of small supermarkets, souvenier shops and cafes nearby as well as internet cafes and a laundromat. I had a single room which was tiny (but probably similar to other London hotels) but had everything I needed (tv, ensuite, tea making facilities). I was on the top floor and even though I'm a fit person I found it hard carrying my luggage up steep narrow stairs up to the top floor. The breakfast room was stuffy and cramped (I had to sit with other guests on small tables). There were a few service issues: the cleaner threw out on of my toileteries, they ran out of a breakfast cereal (the only one I could eat) and I couldn't access my left luggage because the manager (who had the only key) was out. Overall a good experience but next time I'd probably try one of the many other B&Bs in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean & convenient”
Reviews.Author: Rona66
Reviews.Content: We arrived at about 6.30 a. m. on a Thursday morning on the Heathrow Express. It was only a short walk from Paddington Station & very easy to find from the Google Map that we had printed out. We had our breakfast in the basement dining room all very neat & clean. We were on the very top floor O. K. for us but not recommended for those who can't climb up 4 flights of stairs with their luggage. As is typical of London, the room was like a postage stamp but it was clean quiet and had en suite shower, toilet & hand basin. Teas, coffee & hot water are provided also. From here it is only a stone's throw to Hyde park & it is very convenient to tubes, buses, sites etc. There are bigger rooms available than the one we booked, which might be suitable for longer stays.

HotelInfo.Name: Albro House
HotelInfo.Address: 155 Sussex Gardens | Hyde Park, London W2 2RY, England
